newsitem.title: USA: Denktash uses photo op to make political point.
newsitem.headline: Denktash uses photo op to make political point.

text.p: Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash used a photo opportunity on Wednesday to make a political point about the equality of the Greek and Turkish Cypriot communities.

Cypriot President Glafcos Clerides was seated to the right of U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan and Denktash to the left when the U.N. chief opened five days of talks on the Cyprus problem at this rural New York resort.

After Annan finished speaking, the two leaders were ushered into place on either side of him for the traditional handshake photograph, with Clerides again on Annan's right which, according to protocol, is the place of honour.

Denktash, who does not recognise Clerides as president of Cyprus but only as leader of the Greek Cypriot community, then swapped places with his adversary while still shaking hands, saying: "Just for the sake of equality."

The start of a previous round of Cyprus talks in 1992 was delayed for two days after Denktash objected that his interlocutor, then-President George Vassiliou, was officially described as "President of Cyprus" while Denktash was listed as "Leader of the Turkish Cypriot Community."
Denktash is president of a Turkish Cypriot state proclaimed in 1983 but recognised only by Turkey.
